text: Dry weather this summer provided a break from mosquitoes.  Now that we’ve had rain the pesky biters are back.  Standing water = mosquitoes, so make sure that you empty any standing water from outdoor pots, pet bowls, toys, gutters etc. so the mosquitoes cannot breed. pic.twitter.com/HQPyw3YUws
text_html: Dry weather this summer provided a break from mosquitoes. Now that we’ve had rain the pesky biters are back. Standing water = mosquitoes, so make sure that you empty any standing water from outdoor pots, pet bowls, toys, gutters etc. so the mosquitoes cannot breed. pic.twitter.com/HQPyw3YUws
username: Fort Worth Office of Emergency Management

text: You can help keep your community safe from West Nile Virus by emptying mosquito breeding areas that can hold standing water like flower pots, pet bowls, outdoor toys, old tires.  Maintaining your swimming pool chemistry and circulation is also important.

username: Fort Worth Office of Emergency Management

text: You might be in a hurry to get from your car to an air conditioned building during these 100+ degree days but don’t leave before checking the backseat.  This year #hyperthermia has claimed the lives of 25 kids that were left in the vehicle.   Don't forget.  Look before you leave!

text: Dry weather this summer provided a break from mosquitoes.  Now that we’ve had rain the pesky biters are back. text_html: Dry weather this summer provided a break from mosquitoes. Now that we’ve had rain the pesky biters are back. text:
Here are some simple steps to help protect your family from a fire this holiday season:
-Check holiday decoration wiring for cuts or fraying. 
-Don’t overload extension cords. 
-Keep live Christmas trees watered. 
-Keep candles and space heaters three-feet away from flammables.

text: Another cold spell is coming this weekend.  Temperature falling into the 20s overnight means you’ll be heating your home.  Use an electric space heater?  Keep it at least 3 feet away from anything flammable, and don’t use it in damp areas like bathrooms.  @KnoWhat2Do.compic.twitter.com/y3FMFFaw6u

text:
Here are some simple steps to help protect your family from a fire this holiday season:
-Check holiday decoration wiring for cuts or fraying. 
-Don’t overload extension cords. 
-Keep live Christmas trees watered. 
-Keep candles and space heaters three-feet away from flammables.

text:
Seeking Shelter under a bridge is safe.
Winds will actually funnel under the bridge and accelerate which can suck your car out from under the bridge. Also, because of the accelerated winds, debris being tossed around in the air, can become lethal.
#30Days30Ways @kimber12986

text: Good Afternoon Fort Worth! OEM is monitoring a thunderstorm system moving into our area. The main threats are heavy rain & strong winds. The storm is coming in from the North with gusty winds ahead of it. It's not expected to be severe but stay weather ready! #dfwwx #FortWorthpic.twitter.com/54PV4nTC30

text: A Severe Thunderstorm WARNING has been issued by the @NWSFortWorth for SW Tarrant County The main threats from this storm are heavy rain, quarter size hail & lightning. If you are in it's path please go INDOORS and seek shelter away from windows. #dfwwxpic.twitter.com/4PZREuCX7W

text: Heads up Fort Worth  We have a road closure in the Cultural District. Due to a small gas line break Montgomery from El Campo to Byers is CLOSED. Crews are on scene. See the map below for closure area. There are no protective actions necessary. #FortWorthpic.twitter.com/Hglm0RTkXn
